column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////When the pizza arrived and we took our first bite
column2: I could immediately tell that the "butter crust" was worth every calorie. It gave the crust a nice sheen
column4: and a light and crispy crunch when my teeth dug right in. Inside
column5: the smooth and velvety cheese just melted and ooozed through
column6: giving the pepperoni and mushrooms just that extra burst in flavor. I was happy that there were no signs of uncooked or squishy "dough
column7: so common in many flawed deep dish pizzas.
